docs.title: Adverse Outcome Pathway (AOP) Data Model
docs.text: This LinkML schema models Adverse Outcome Pathways (AOPs) - structured representations of biological pathways linking molecular initiating events to adverse outcomes at the organism or population level.

docs.title: What are AOPs?
docs.text: An Adverse Outcome Pathway describes a sequential chain of causally linked events at different biological levels that lead from a molecular initiating event (MIE) through intermediate key events (KEs) to an adverse outcome (AO). AOPs are used in toxicology, environmental health, and risk assessment to understand how chemical exposures or other stressors lead to adverse health effects.

docs.title: Schema Components
docs.text:
This data model captures:

  • Adverse Outcome Pathways: Complete pathways linking molecular initiating events to adverse outcomes
  • Key Events: Measurable biological changes at molecular, cellular, organ, or organism levels
  • Key Event Relationships: Directed associations between key events with supporting evidence
  • Measurement Processes: Detailed specifications of experimental methods, assays, and measurements used to assess key events
  • Scientific Evidence: Supporting data from peer-reviewed literature

docs.title: Context
docs.text:
This schema is part of the Source-to-Outcome (S2O) continuum framework, enabling standardized representation of biological pathway data for:

  • Environmental health and safety assessment
  • Toxicological pathway analysis
  • Risk assessment and regulatory decision-making
  • Integration with chemical exposure and epidemiological data

docs.title: AOP Data Model
docs.text:
A LinkML data model for representing Adverse Outcome Pathways (AOPs), Key Events (KEs), and Key Event Relationships (KERs) in the context of the Source-to-Outcome (S2O) continuum.

URI: https://w3id.org/EHS-Data-Standards/aop-model

Name: aop-model

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description NamedEntity Base class for all named entities in the model AdverseOutcomePathway A structured representation of biological events linking a molecular initiati... Assay The specific method or assay used to measure a key event Association Base class for associations/relationships in the model KeyEventAssociation A causal or associative relationship between two key events in an adverse out... ContextField Metadata fields that capture important contextual information for reproducibi... InputSample Description of the biological sample or experimental manipulation used as inp... KeyEvent A measurable change in biological state that is a necessary step in a pathway... ASLHeightEvent Key event representing changes in airway surface liquid height CFTRFunctionEvent Key event representing changes in CFTR function CiliaNumberEvent Key event representing changes in cilia number or length CiliaryBeatFrequencyEvent Key event representing changes in ciliary beat frequency EGFRActivationEvent Molecular initiating event involving EGFR activation FoxJ1ExpressionEvent Key event representing changes in FoxJ1 expression GobletCellEvent Key event representing changes in goblet cell number LungFunctionEvent Adverse outcome representing decreased lung function MucinProductionEvent Key event representing changes in mucin production MucociliaryClearanceEvent Key event representing changes in mucociliary clearance OxidativeStressEvent Molecular initiating event involving oxidative stress MeasurementProcess A generic class representing the process of measuring a biological key event ASLHeightMeasurement Measurement of airway surface liquid height CFTRFunctionMeasurement Measurement of CFTR-mediated ion transport function CiliaBeatFrequencyMeasurement Measurement of ciliary beat frequency GobletCellMeasurement Measurement of goblet cell number or mucin production MucociliaryClearanceMeasurement Measurement of mucociliary clearance/transport OxidativeStressMeasurement Measurement of oxidative stress markers OutputMeasurement The quantitative or qualitative output from a measurement process Publication Any published piece of information, following Biolink model QuantityValue A quantity value expresses a measurement with a numeric value and a unit

docs.title: Enumerations
docs.text: Enumeration Description AssayTypeEnum Types of assays from the Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI) BiologicalLevelEnum The level of biological organization at which an event occurs DirectionEnum Direction of change for a key event EvidenceStrengthEnum Strength of evidence supporting a relationship KeyEventPredicateEnum Types of relationships between key events in an AOP KeyEventTypeEnum Classification of key events in an AOP

description: The level of biological organization at which an event occurs
from_schema: https://w3id.org/EHS-Data-Standards/aop-model

  MOLECULAR:
    text: MOLECULAR
    description: Macro-molecular interactions (e.g., receptor binding, protein modification)
  CELLULAR:
    text: CELLULAR
    description: Cellular response (e.g., cell signaling, gene expression, cell death)
  TISSUE:
    text: TISSUE
    description: Tissue-level response (e.g., inflammation, tissue damage)
  ORGAN:
    text: ORGAN
    description: Organ-level response (e.g., impaired organ function)
  ORGANISM:
    text: ORGANISM
    description: Organism-level outcome (e.g., disease, mortality)
  POPULATION:
    text: POPULATION
    description: Population-level outcome (e.g., disease incidence, public health
      impact)

docs.title: Class: KeyEvent
docs.text:
A measurable change in biological state that is a necessary step in a pathway from

a molecular initiating event to an adverse outcome. Key Events can represent molecular,

cellular, tissue, organ, or organism-level changes.

__

  • NOTE: this is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly
